body.p:
To His Excellency B. Magoffin
Governor of Kentucky

Your Petitioner, Charles Sauter, states that at the August Term 1861, of the City Court of Louisville he was fined $20 -- for selling liquor without license. He keeps a small retail Grocery -- by which he barely supports himself & family. The costs in the case amount to $16.10 which he has part. The information against him was given by a public prostitute, whom he refused to credit for Groceries, and who was largely indebted to him at the time, and failing to obtain further credit she vented her spite against him by having him fined He respectfully asks for a remission of the fine
I know the petitioner well, and have information since M. Sauter was fined, which had I known at the time I would not have prosecuted him. I think Justice would be served were the fine remitted
We the undersigned neighbors of Chas Sauter Join in his petition

W. J. Clark
Henry Morielli
A Thosmyer
D. S. Griffiths
Chas Fais.
Frank Herm.
Otto Winstel
Moriss Brandel
Jacob Roost
